context: A directed acyclic graph (DAG) is formed by a collection of vertices and edges, without any directed cycles.

context: A vertex in a directed graph is reachable from another vertex if there exists a path from the former to the latter.
sentence_true: If a vertex can reach itself via a nontrivial path, then that path forms a cycle.
sentence_false: If a vertex can reach itself via any path, then reachability is established without forming a cycle.

context: The transitive closure of a directed acyclic graph is the graph that represents the same reachability relation with the most edges possible.
sentence_true: It contains an edge for every related pair of distinct elements in the reachability relation of the DAG.
sentence_false: It is formed by removing edges to create fewer connections while maintaining the reachability relation.

context: Directed acyclic graphs can also represent a network of processing elements, where data flows through them.
sentence_true: This allows for efficient data processing by performing operations as soon as inputs are available.
sentence_false: This limits operations to sequential processing, where each element must wait for the previous one to finish.

context: The closure problem in directed acyclic graphs seeks a minimum weight subset of vertices with no edges connecting them to the rest of the graph.
sentence_true: This problem may be formulated for directed graphs without the assumption of acyclicity, but retains its nature in contractions of the graph.
sentence_false: This problem can only be formulated for acyclic graphs and not for directed graphs in general.

context: Chagas disease, also known as American trypanosomiasis, is caused by the protozoan Trypanosoma cruzi and primarily spread by insects known as kissing bugs.
sentence_true: Chagas disease can also be transmitted through blood transfusion, organ transplantation, and vertical transmission from mother to fetus.
sentence_false: Chagas disease can only be transmitted through kissing bugs and cannot be spread through other means.

context: The acute phase of Chagas disease typically occurs unnoticed and can exhibit mild symptoms that are not unique to the disease.
sentence_true: If symptoms develop during the acute phase, they usually resolve spontaneously within three to eight weeks in approximately 90% of individuals.
sentence_false: If symptoms develop during the acute phase, they usually worsen and persist without resolution in all individuals.

context: Chagas disease is predominantly found in endemic Latin American countries, but cases have also been reported in non-endemic regions, including parts of Europe and the United States.
sentence_true: Despite hygienic measures, chronic Chagas disease remains a major health problem in many Latin American countries.
sentence_false: Chronic Chagas disease has been eradicated in all Latin American countries due to effective hygienic measures.

context: Medication for Chagas disease is most effective early in the course of infection, especially during the acute phase.
sentence_true: Benznidazole and nifurtimox are antiparasitic drugs that can be used for treatment of Chagas disease.
sentence_false: Chagas disease can only be treated with surgery, not with antiparasitic medications.

context: In Chagas endemic areas, transmission is typically through triatomine bugs that feed on the blood of humans and animals.
sentence_true: Triatomine bugs hide during the day and emerge at night to feed on people, which is why they are called 'kissing bugs'.
sentence_false: Triatomine bugs are active during the day and feed on humans at that time.

context: The most recognized marker of acute Chagas disease is called Romaña's sign, which involves swelling of the eyelids near the bite wound.
sentence_true: The acute phase can also be severe in individuals with weakened immune systems.
sentence_false: The acute phase is always mild and cannot be severe, regardless of immune system status.

context: Chagas disease has been reported to affect millions of people in Latin America as well as increasing cases in non-endemic countries.
sentence_true: Chagas disease was first described by Brazilian physician Carlos Chagas in 1909.
sentence_false: Chagas disease was first described by Salvador Mazza in the 1920s.

context: Chagas disease complications can include cardiac damage, leading to heart rhythm abnormalities and other serious issues.

sentence_false: Chronic Chagas disease can be completely cured in the symptomatic phase with the right treatment.

context: Preventive measures for Chagas disease focus on reducing contact with the insect vectors and improving residential conditions in endemic areas.
sentence_true: No effective vaccine for Chagas disease has been developed as of 2013.
sentence_false: An effective vaccine for Chagas disease has been developed and is widely used in endemic regions.

context: Anekāntavāda is a fundamental doctrine in Jainism that emphasizes the notion of perceiving reality from multiple viewpoints.

context: The parable of the blind men and an elephant illustrates the many-sided nature of truth.

context: Anekāntavāda also distinguishes itself from moral relativism.
